name: John H. GLOVER, Petitioner, v. G. A. ENGLAND, Director of Motor Vehicles, Respondent

court.name: District of Columbia Municipal Court of Appeals

judges: Before ROVER, Chief Judge, and HOOD and QUINN, Associate Judges.
parties: John H. GLOVER, Petitioner, v. G. A. ENGLAND, Director of Motor Vehicles, Respondent.

opinions.text:
PER CURIAM.
Petitioner seeks review of an order revoking his motor vehicle operator’s permit under the Point System. His main contentions have been answered by previous decisions of this court. See East v. Director of Vehicles and Traffic of the District of Columbia, D.C.Mun.App., 150 A. 2d 633 and cases there cited.
Petitioner also attacks the validity of one of the offenses charged against him. This attack comes too late. It should have been made in the Traffic Court, but instead petitioner elected to forfeit collateral. In this proceeding he is bound by his court record.
Affirmed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Henry J. Balzer, Washington, D. C., for petitioner.

Ted D. Kuemmerling, Asst. Corp. Counsel, Washington D. C., with whom Chester H. Gray, Corp. Counsel, Milton D. Kor-man, Principal Asst. Corp. Counsel, and Hubert B. Pair, Asst. Corp. Counsel, Washington, D. C., were on the brief, for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
John H. GLOVER, Petitioner, v. G. A. ENGLAND, Director of Motor Vehicles, Respondent.
No. 2335.
Municipal Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia.
Argued Feb. 24, 1959.
Decided May 20, 1959.
Henry J. Balzer, Washington, D. C., for petitioner.
Ted D. Kuemmerling, Asst. Corp. Counsel, Washington D. C., with whom Chester H. Gray, Corp. Counsel, Milton D. Kor-man, Principal Asst. Corp. Counsel, and Hubert B. Pair, Asst. Corp. Counsel, Washington, D. C., were on the brief, for respondent.
Before ROVER, Chief Judge, and HOOD and QUINN, Associate Judges.
